result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody M Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances.
If defendant complies with the requirements of the sentence, Court grants expungement upon successful completion.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA, treatment or program. Random screening.

timeConds.notes: Perform 50 hours of community service at 8 hours per month commencing 9-1-15.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF FAILURE TO MEET CONDITIONS FOR EXPUNGEMENT RECEIVED AND FILED. OS

Defendant Cody M Miller in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 10 months at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for actual work and 3 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  18 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine $500 plus mandatory costs, assessments, DNA surcharges and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) maintain employment; 7) perform 50 hours of community service at 8 hours per month commencing 9-1-15. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  If defendant complies with the requirements of the sentence, Court grants expungement upon successful completion.

Defendant Cody M Miller in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody M Miller in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for ruling on the motion hearing that occurred on 07/17/2015. For reasons stated on the record, the Court denied the defense motion suppress evidence. Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 08/19/2015.  A final-pre trial date was selected to accommodate the both parties schedules. All final pre-trial documents should be submitted by the next court date. Case adjourned.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody M Miller in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion hearing proceeded.  Sequestration ordered.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy, Dean Zirzow; Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy, Travis Thompson.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for defense: Citizen Witness, Jaden K., and Citizen Witness, Lucas M.  Court held colloquy with defendant on his right to testify and right to testify.  Defense and state rests.  Evidentiary phase is complete.  Closing arguments made.  Case adjourned for oral ruling on 7/22/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court will reschedule the final pretrial.  aw  Oral ruling scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's response to the defendant's motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Cody M Miller in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has filed a motion.  State to respond by 6/1/2015.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and motion hearing on 7/17/2015 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 8/19/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion to suppress fruits of vehicle search, and affidavit in support, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Cody M Miller in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like to file a motion.  State to provide a offer.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/6/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody M Miller in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Paul Hauer for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-18-2015 at 01:30 pm.
